overview:
## Discussion

This property is used to identify a node in other parts of your game logic. For example, you might use this name as part of collision testing. You can also search for nodes in a tree by their name.

When choosing a name for a node, decide whether each node gets a unique name or whether some nodes will share a common name. If you give the node a unique name, you can find the node later by calling the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/childNode(withName:)] method. If a name is shared by multiple nodes, the name usually means that these are all a similar object type in your game. In this case, you can iterate over those objects by calling the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/enumerateChildNodes(withName:using:)] method.

# name

**Instance Property**

The node’s assignable name.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var name: String? { get set }
```

```swift
var name: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property is used to identify a node in other parts of your game logic. For example, you might use this name as part of collision testing. You can also search for nodes in a tree by their name.

When choosing a name for a node, decide whether each node gets a unique name or whether some nodes will share a common name. If you give the node a unique name, you can find the node later by calling the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/childNode(withName:)] method. If a name is shared by multiple nodes, the name usually means that these are all a similar object type in your game. In this case, you can iterate over those objects by calling the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKNode/enumerateChildNodes(withName:using:)] method.

## Accessing Nodes by Name

- **Searching the Node Tree**: Access nodes by name to avoid needing an instance variable.
- **childNode(withName:)**: Searches the children of the receiving node for a node with a specific name.
- **enumerateChildNodes(withName:using:)**: Searches the children of the receiving node to perform processing for nodes that share a name.
- **subscript(_:)**: Returns an array of nodes that match the name parameter.
